overview:
Joseph has spent fourteen years dedicated to building and promoting innovative web products and services, leading marketing, management, sales, and product teams based in San Francisco, while managing teams in Sydney, Singapore, Mumbai, Beijing, and London.

He sold a web startup he co-founded (BizQuiz.com) to a global company partly owned by Cisco, and headed marketing on a small senior management team at Score (funded by Bill Hewlett) when they sold the company to The Washington Post.

Joseph has spent the past 10 years between the U.S. and Asia, building and marketing web companies in the b2c and b2b spaces. On the b2b side, he won major accounts with Google, Sony, HP, Cisco, LinkedIn and many other Fortune 500 companies. He headed a company that repeatedly set records for the most industry awards received every year, and headed a team that created the viral web hit Peter Packet, which later spun off Pocket God (the first paid iPhone app to hit 1MM downloads).

Joseph spent the last six years in social media: a community, social website for high school and college students in Asia, and a Facebook app where brands engage their customers in Customer Advisor Boards (clients include LinkedIn, Google, SAP, Kraft).

He is an advisor for OnTheGo (Beijing/NY cross-cultural mobile app), Lexercise (web tool for dyslexia), and JobJuice (interview prep mobile app), and volunteer for the Biehl Foundation (South African NGO working in townships).
